context: The Estonian word 'puutub' is the third-person singular present form of the verb 'puuduma/puutuda'. It means 'touches', 'reaches', or 'relates to/concerns/involves'. This verb can be used both physically (touching something with a hand) and metaphorically (when topics, people, or situations are related or connected). The root word is 'puud-', which relates to contact or connection.
